Omiscid::LocalVariableListener

virtual bool IsValid (Service &ServiceRef, const SimpleString VarName, const SimpleString NewValue)=0

Detailed Description

Defines the listener interface for all Omiscid variables of a service. This interface must be implemented in order to receive notifications.

Author:
Dominique Vaufreydaz

Definition at line 28 of file LocalVariableListener.h.

Member Function Documentation

virtual bool Omiscid::LocalVariableListener::IsValid (  Service &  ServiceRef,
const SimpleString  VarName,
const SimpleString  NewValue
)  [pure virtual]
 

This method is called when a value modification is requested on a variable. This method must check that this new value is a valid value for us.

Parameters:
ServiceRef the service owning the variable
VarName the current value of the variable
NewValue the new requested value
Returns:
true if the new value is accepted, false if rejected.

virtual void Omiscid::LocalVariableListener::VariableChanged (  Service &  ServiceRef,
const SimpleString  VarName,
const SimpleString  NewValue
)  [pure virtual]
 

This method is called when the value of a variable changes

Parameters:
ServiceRef the service owning the variable
VarName the name of the variable which value has changed
NewValue the new value of the variable
